特記事項: 【合併】総合日本学習科目（外交）（CIEC）/Japan's Foreign Relations（国際学部）
授業方法: This class will be taught in a face-to-face format.

第1回: Introduction: Japan and the United States: From Enemies to Allies

Read: Pyle, Chapters 1 and 2.
Refer: パイル, 第一章, 第二章.
第2回: The Cold War Opportunity and the Yoshida Doctrine

Read: Pyle, Chapters 3 and 4.
Refer: Pyle, Chapters 5 and 6;
パイル, 第三章ー第六章.
第3回: Asia Before the End of the Cold War

Read: Tanaka, Chapter 1.
Refer: 田中, 第一章.
第4回: The End of the Cold War I: Northeast Asia

Read: Tanaka, Chapter 2.
Refer: 田中, 第ニ章.
第5回: The End of the Cold War II: Southeast Asia

Read: Tanaka, Chapter 3.
Refer: 田中, 第三章.
第6回:
Read: Tanaka, Chapter 4.
Refer: 田中, 第四章.
第8回: Security Challenges: Rising China and Unstable North Korea

Read: Tanaka, Chapter 5.
Refer: 田中, 第五章.
第9回: The Weight of the Past: History and Diplomacy

Read: Pyle, Chapter 7; Tanaka, Chapter 6.
Refer: パイル第七章; 田中, 第六章.
第10回: The Asian Financial Crisis and Japan

Read: Tanaka, Chapter 7.
Refer: 田中, 第七章.
第11回:
Read: Tanaka, Chapter 8
Refer: 田中, 第八章

Read: Tanaka, Chapters 9, 10.
Refer: 田中, 第九章, 第十章.
第13回: Read Tanaka, Chapter 11; Kenneth B. Pyle, "The Abe Restoration."

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
This course will help students to understand and analyze problems in international relations, particularly those that deal with those of people from different regions and cultures. In addition, it will help them to develop their powers of autonomous learning by giving them the skills to identify the sorts of problems that require investigation.

Students will be expected to participate in class discussions and may be asked to complete small assignments from time to time.
